item.title: Selling The Mobile Web
item.description: Everyone’s screaming "We need to be ’on’ mobile!" What does that even mean? Where do you start? One of the biggest challenges is getting clients, coworkers and stakeholders on board with the mobile web and actually execute a project the right way. The hurdles are many: lack of understanding of the medium, small budgets, outdated processes and many more. Every organization is different so changing existing behaviors and processes takes a lot of effort, patience and time. This presentation shows you how to execute a mobile web project successfully with a cross-disciplinary team. We’ll provide a set of helpful tools and practices to get you started and help educate your coworkers and clients at the same time. Topics discussed: - Selling the mobile-first philosophy and strategy Using mobile as an excuse to develop a strong content strategy - Overcoming "App-itis" (people’s tendency to think anything made for mobile needs to be a native app) - How to create future-friendly mobile web experiences
item.content:encoded: Everyone’s screaming "We need to be ’on’ mobile!" What does that even mean? Where do you start? One of the biggest challenges is getting clients, coworkers and stakeholders on board with the mobile web and actually execute a project the right way. The hurdles are many: lack of understanding of the medium, small budgets, outdated processes and many more. Every organization is different so changing existing behaviors and processes takes a lot of effort, patience and time. This presentation shows you how to execute a mobile web project successfully with a cross-disciplinary team. We’ll provide a set of helpful tools and practices to get you started and help educate your coworkers and clients at the same time. Topics discussed: - Selling the mobile-first philosophy and strategy Using mobile as an excuse to develop a strong content strategy - Overcoming "App-itis" (people’s tendency to think anything made for mobile needs to be a native app) - How to create future-friendly mobile web experiences

media:content.media:title: Selling The Mobile Web
media:content.media:description:
Everyone's screaming "We need to be 'on' mobile!" What does that even mean? Where do you start? One of the biggest challenges is getting clients, coworkers and stakeholders on board with the mobile web and actually execute a project the right way. The hurdles are many: lack of understanding of the medium, small budgets, outdated processes and many more. Every organization is different so changing existing behaviors and processes takes a lot of effort, patience and time.
This presentation shows you how to execute a mobile web project successfully with a cross-disciplinary team. We'll provide a set of helpful tools and practices to get you started and help educate your coworkers and clients at the same time.
Topics discussed: - Selling the mobile-first philosophy and strategy Using mobile as an excuse to develop a strong content strategy - Overcoming "App-itis" (people's tendency to think anything made for mobile needs to be a native app) - How to create future-friendly mobile web experiences
media:content.media:text: Everyone’s screaming "We need to be ’on’ mobile!" What does that even mean? Where do you start? One of the biggest challenges is getting clients, coworkers and stakeholders on board with the mobile web and actually execute a project the right way. The hurdles are many: lack of understanding of the medium, small budgets, outdated processes and many more. Every organization is different so changing existing behaviors and processes takes a lot of effort, patience and time. This presentation shows you how to execute a mobile web project successfully with a cross-disciplinary team. We’ll provide a set of helpful tools and practices to get you started and help educate your coworkers and clients at the same time. Topics discussed: - Selling the mobile-first philosophy and strategy Using mobile as an excuse to develop a strong content strategy - Overcoming "App-itis" (people’s tendency to think anything made for mobile needs to be a native app) - How to create future-friendly mobile web experiences

item.title: How to survive Burning Man
item.description: Attending Burning Man was the best decision ever made. This event in the temporary Black Rock City (Nevada desert), opened my eyes and gave me a better perspective on life. Can’t wait to go back. So, I’ve put some reminders in a Slideshare presentation. For me and all that wish to go there sometime. Hope to see your there! Feel free to share the presentation and add more tips if you are a regular Burner.
item.content:encoded: Attending Burning Man was the best decision ever made. This event in the temporary Black Rock City (Nevada desert), opened my eyes and gave me a better perspective on life. Can’t wait to go back. So, I’ve put some reminders in a Slideshare presentation. For me and all that wish to go there sometime. Hope to see your there! Feel free to share the presentation and add more tips if you are a regular Burner.

Feel free to share the presentation and add more tips if you are a regular Burner.

item.title: 10 Social Media Meccas: Where to Get Connected Worldwide
item.description: Multiple surveys have been conducted to determine the most “socially connected” cities. In contrast, we wanted to highlight truly international cities that personify the social way of life in their own unique ways. We started our research working from a list of the “Top Twitter User Cities,” moved to how social was being used in those cities, and then tried to venture off the beaten path a bit to offer some surprises. We went in search of the best social media meccas, and discovered the cities with the most users on Twitter, the most widespread broadband connection, and the most innovative uses of social media (like crime fighting and online dating). For all of you adventurous social media fans, consider this your passport to social adventure …

item.title: Anatomy of Our 'Viral' Wedding Proposal
item.description: I created a website ( http://JulieWillYouMarry.me ) to propose to my girlfriend Julie in July 2011 and after it making it to the front page of reddit… it became somewhat of an internet sensation. This slide show discusses some of the reasons it might have spread so far.
item.content:encoded: I created a website ( http://JulieWillYouMarry.me ) to propose to my girlfriend Julie in July 2011 and after it making it to the front page of reddit… it became somewhat of an internet sensation. This slide show discusses some of the reasons it might have spread so far.

item.title: Dreamforce 2011 Social Enterprise Keynote @benioff @salesforce
item.description: Salesforce.com Chairman & CEO Mark Benioff presented this keynote at Dreamforce 2011 on August 31, 2011 at San Francisco’s Moscone Convention Center. Marc Benioff presented Salesforce’s vision of how its cloud computing solutions can transform companies into Social Enterprises, enabling organizations to delight their customers in amazing new ways. View the keynote videos at: http://www.youtube.com/dreamforce

item.title: Designing Information: Making it Immersive
item.description: Everyone has to pass along information. Whether it’s in a presentation, conversation or other venue. All of these forms of communication have one thing in common... they could use some design. This talk (that I hopefully will get to present one day) seeks to demonstrate the elements of design and their applicability to forms of communication.
item.content:encoded: Everyone has to pass along information. Whether it’s in a presentation, conversation or other venue. All of these forms of communication have one thing in common... they could use some design. This talk (that I hopefully will get to present one day) seeks to demonstrate the elements of design and their applicability to forms of communication.
